page.title: 20CHANGING TIMES W.READING
page.content: The site of current{Dee Road}estate was at the time mostly allotments.At the top was Ranikhet camp,occupied by American G.I.'s during the war. Water_ mead Estate was{Collier and Cathey's {brickworks}and the sandbuckets collected sand from Kentwood Hill to carry back across the bottom of Grovelands Road at the junction with Water Road into the brickworks.All that remains is the War Memorial in Water Road.At the bottom of Grovelands Road was a small stream, and a small but dense wood,where children used to build camps.The site abounded with Dragonflies in summer. Many of the houses in Grovelands Road were built from Colliers brickworks. {Local traders}included a rag and bone man,a muffin man,ringing a bell and the Co_op roundsman fresh bread and cakes in a horse drawn cart.
